reasoning: Initial Xcode project setup with Clean Architecture scaffolding. Standard iOS development patterns with no external dependencies. Core Data is a built-in iOS framework requiring no research. Multiple files/folders but well-defined structure.

scope.notes: Greenfield project setup: 5 directory structure + Core Data model + basic App files (BodiiApp.swift, ContentView.swift, etc.)

integrations.notes: Using only standard iOS frameworks (SwiftUI, Core Data). No external APIs or third-party libraries.

infrastructure.notes: Core Data model creation (.xcdatamodeld) - standard iOS persistence, not external database infrastructure. Basic Xcode project configuration.

knowledge.notes: Clean Architecture is well-documented. SwiftUI and Core Data are standard iOS frameworks with extensive documentation. Reference docs (ERD, Dev Guide) provided.

concerns: Project structure must match Clean Architecture principles
Core Data model must align with ERD specification
risk.notes: Greenfield setup with no existing code to break. Main risk is incorrect architecture setup requiring later refactoring.

validation_recommendations.reasoning: Initial project scaffolding with no business logic. Validation limited to verifying project compiles and runs. No security concerns as no data handling or API endpoints yet.
